subject: Fixes to rpmlint and license related issues
commitMessage:
Fixes to rpmlint and license related issues

- Use %license macro to package license file
- License of this package is actually BSD-3-clause not GPLv2
- Package does not contain any binaries so it can be made noarch
- Changed package group to the one that exists

Change-Id: I303f321e81c051bbe433a67ded95663983e8032c
Signed-off-by: Jacek Bukarewicz <j.bukarewicz@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI:Release: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:Mobile: 

 repository     arch           result         

 qemu           x86_64         succeeded      

 qemu           armv7l         succeeded      

 qemu           i586           succeeded
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:Mobile: 

 repository     arch           result         

 emulator       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI:Release: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Rebased commit as I noticed that another one was accepted in the meantime.
I also verified on RD-PQ device which currently boots partially, but I believe that's enough for this particular package.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

looks fine

Patch Set 2:

I grep the source, in both lsb_release and lsb_release.py it contains the GPLv2 License announcement. why do you think it is BSD-3-clause?

Patch Set 2:

Here are the contents of this package
/lib/lsb/init-functions
/usr/share/licenses/lsb
/usr/share/licenses/lsb/lsb

init-functions is under BSD-3-clause license, /usr/share/licenses/lsb/lsb contains BSD-3-clause license text. lsb_release* files that you mentioned are not shipped with this package

Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

Good. Thanks for clarification.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Remove debian packaging stuff
commitMessage:
Remove debian packaging stuff

Change-Id: Ib2d6fc056dd871cc539b431b53ac2db65a249521
Signed-off-by: Chengwei Yang <chengwei.yang@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        succeeded      

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       armv7l         succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

Why does nobody review this change? I think it's an apparently necessary change because now rpm is used as package manager.

Even though I'm not the maintainer of this git, I see this change hang around for too long time and accept this.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
